Compute
\[\sum_{k = 1}^\infty \frac{k + 2}{k! + (k + 1)! + (k + 2)!}.\]

Solution:

We can write
\begin{align*}
\frac{k + 2}{k! + (k + 1)! + (k + 2)!} &= \frac{k + 2}{k! (1 + k + 1 + (k + 1)(k + 2))} \\
&= \frac{k + 2}{k! (k^2 + 4k + 4)} \\
&= \frac{k + 2}{k! (k + 2)^2} \\
&= \frac{1}{k! (k + 2)}.
\end{align*}Then
\begin{align*}
\sum_{k = 1}^\infty \frac{k + 2}{k! + (k + 1)! + (k + 2)!} &= \sum_{k = 1}^\infty \frac{1}{k! (k + 2)} \\
&= \sum_{k = 1}^\infty \frac{(k + 1) - k}{k! (k + 2)} \\
&= \sum_{k = 1}^\infty \left( \frac{k + 1}{k! (k + 2)} - \frac{k}{k! (k + 2)} \right) \\
&= \sum_{k = 1}^\infty \left( \frac{1}{k! (k + 1)} - \frac{1}{(k + 1)!} \right) \\
&= \left( \frac{1}{1! \cdot 2} - \frac{1}{2!} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{2! \cdot 3} - \frac{1}{3!} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{3! \cdot 4} - \frac{1}{4!} \right) + \dotsb \\
&= \boxed{\frac{1}{2}}.
\end{align*}Final Answer: $\boxed{\frac{1}{2}}$. I hope it is correct.

&= \frac{k + 2}{k! (k^2 + 4k + 4)} \\
&= \frac{k + 2}{k! (k + 2)^2} \\
&= \frac{1}{k! (k + 2)} \\
&= \frac{k + 1}{k! (k + 1)(k + 2)} \\
&= \frac{k + 1}{(k + 2)!}.
\end{align*}Seeking a way to get the sum to telescope, we can express the numerator $k + 1$ as $(k + 2) - 1.$  Then
\[\frac{k + 1}{(k + 2)!} = \frac{(k + 2) - 1}{(k + 2)!} = \frac{k + 2}{(k + 2)!} - \frac{1}{(k + 2)!} = \frac{1}{(k + 1)!} - \frac{1}{(k + 2)!}.\]Therefore,
\[\sum_{k = 1}^\infty \frac{k + 2}{k! + (k + 1)! + (k + 2)!} = \left( \frac{1}{2!} - \frac{1}{3!} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{3!} - \frac{1}{4!} \right) + \left( \frac{1}{4!} - \frac{1}{5!} \right) + \dotsb = \boxed{\frac{1}{2}}.\]
